title: math behind the mmr, the one to solve this problem gets a cookie
body:
Hello, i didnt find a pervious thread of similar issue to this, when season ended i was gold 5 and after abit of playing in preseason i managed to achive platinum 4 in week and a half. Queastion is, is it worth putting more time to ranked, because im not sure if it even influences next season placement. Can someone tell me, if next seasons placement uses the mmr of season 7 end or preseason end mmr.
ty

replies.body:
the math isnt exact i would say

one season i wont 6/10, went from bronze 3 to bronze 2....

last season or so i again won 6/10...went from offseason gold 2 (one win away from gold 1 in a series with one won already) and i got put into b3.....(think i ended season at silver 1)

pretty much everything u do in offseason is irrelevant..... and as far as math....i won same amount both times and ended up higher one time and over a full ranked tier doing the same but higher

How is it possible to be placed in bronze with 6 wins on promo and with g2 mmr.  The numbres just dont add up. lowest i have ever been placed to is silver 3 with 5 wins. even if i was unranked, but i have never been placed to bronze.. Are you sure?{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

> [{quoted}](name=Capta1n V1etnam,realm=EUNE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pquOgPVx,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-11-21T15:27:37.610+0000)
>
> How is it possible to be placed in bronze with 6 wins on promo and with g2 mmr.  The numbres just dont add up. lowest i have ever been placed to is silver 3 with 5 wins. even if i was unranked, but i have never been placed to bronze.. Are you sure?{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

its easy, i ended the season at silver1-2 (offseason doesnt count at all...they say very slightly but it doesnt since this happened) and i got to gold 2 in the offseason

once new season rolled around, it takes everyones mmr around like silver 3-4 and brings them closer to it (aka if your above you go down and if your below you go up....in mmr)

you see pros that were challenger play? they can lose all games and they still get plat 1....and its again for this reason (but pros have enough mmr that its still wildly above everyone else, the number got closer to silver but only by so much and rank is just a face to your mmr number so its not always right as shown by every season reset for people plat+)

this is same reason golds get into silver and vice versa every reset...

all i know is 100%, went from gold2 in offseason, won 6 games, and got bronze 3.....this was the moment i stopped caring about ranked in general

if you dont believe me just try it out if your a gold+, get to silver 1-2 in the season, then get to gold 2 in offseason, then win 6/10 and tell me you dont drop over a whole division and change

Yes, your rank during the preseason will affect your rank during your next season's placements. But keep in mind that no matter what rank you had during the preseason, your rank in the next season will be lower.
Perviously new rank could be calculated . Your old rank -10 divisions+ 1 division for every win. Dia 5 5 wins should be p5. Can sb confirm?

When the new season starts you'll still have to play through your placements as always, but your previous season's MMR is ***very slightly*** taken into account. Just because you made Plat last year doesn't mean you place there though!
If I haven't played ranked since S3, will I basically be treated as a new player, or will I still have some sort of residual MMR left after all these years?

this is a smurf account btw, i ended up figuring out that starting a new account is 50x easier than climbing normally

i got 2 accounts to gold in under 100 games, one i did it in 60's.....and the account that i first created it took me literally thousands of games to get there and when i finally did i got it cut out from under me, so i went the smurf route for the skins for the season (beats just not having them i guess)

but then next season it all just starts again and everyone gets kicked down/up and the matchmaking quality turns into even more crap lol (start of season ragequitters and afks and broken stuff usually run rampant) and its just chaos.....if your serious about it you'd want to just wait a month or 2 to let the good people go back up and the bad people to go back down

matchmaking is just bad but its setup to be that way for a reason, hence the win/lose streaks everyone gets mixed with the probability of 10's of millions of people all having 50% winrate.....just looking at the skill level of my teammates and the enemies its easy to tell its not by perfectly balanced matches....and this leaves only one other option
